abstract: Bank of America and Wachovia, two of the nation’s largest banks, said Tuesday that their profits rose sharply in the fourth quarter compared with the same period a year earlier. Results at both banks were helped by major acquisitions in 2006. Bank of America, which bought the credit-card giant MBNA last year, said its net income rose 47 percent, to $5.26 billion, in the fourth quarter. Wachovia, which picked up Golden West Financial, said its fourth-quarter profit increased 35 percent, to $2.3 billion.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America and Wachovia, two of the nation’s largest banks, said Tuesday that their profits rose sharply in the fourth quarter compared with the same period a year earlier. Results at both banks were helped by major acquisitions in 2006. Bank of America, which bought the credit-card giant MBNA last year, said its net income rose 47 percent, to $5.26 billion, in the fourth quarter. Wachovia, which picked up Golden West Financial, said its fourth-quarter profit increased 35 percent, to $2.3 billion.
